function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Poorly documented process of harmonising and integrating data from existing projects","Impact":"Risk of data quality issues, lack of reproducibility, and transparency in the harmonisation process.","Mitigation":"Documentation of the harmonisation process, training for data harmonisation, and implementation of international standards and protocols.","Technologies":"Data harmonisation tools, data quality validation software, and version control systems for data reproducibility.","People":"Data scientists, project managers, and researchers involved in data harmonisation.","Owner":"Project managers, funding organizations, and international standard-setting bodies."},{"Description":"Need for future strategies for largescale harmonisation of individual data","Impact":"Limited capacity to handle the time-consuming manual work and potential for errors in the harmonisation process.","Mitigation":"Development of automated data harmonisation pipelines, adoption of advanced statistical methods, and investment in data harmonisation infrastructure.","Technologies":"Automation tools, machine learning algorithms for data integration, and advanced statistical software for bias control.","People":"Data engineers, statistical analysts, and experts in data standardization.","Owner":"Data management teams, research institutions, and funding agencies."},{"Description":"Challenges in controlling competing risks and biases when harmonizing data from heterogeneous populations","Impact":"Risk of inaccurate analysis and interpretation of harmonised data, leading to flawed conclusions and decision-making.","Mitigation":"Use of appropriate statistical methods, rigorous data validation processes, and consideration of population diversity in data harmonisation.","Technologies":"Statistical software for bias correction, data validation algorithms, and population-level data stratification tools.","People":"Epidemiologists, biostatisticians, and public health researchers involved in data analysis.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies, and organizations promoting data transparency and accountability."}]}
